hints.aufenthaltsstatus_andere_staaten_hinweis:
Based on your information, you normally require a visa from a German Embassy to travel into or pursue gainful employment in Germany. For that reason you can not continue the online-service.
This is a provisional assessment of the online service. For a definitive statement, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
hints.aufenthaltsstatus_eu_ewr_staaten_ausser_:
Based on your information, you probably have rights of free movement and for that reason you do not require a visa to travel to Germany or a residence permit to stay in Germany. For that reason you can not continue the online-service.
This is a provisional assessment of the online service. For a definitive statement, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
If you already know that you are no longer entitled to freedom of movement (e.g., because a German authority has revoked this privilege for you), please contact the Immigration Office too.
Further information you get [here][https://www.bmi.bund.de/EN/topics/migration/law-on-foreigners/freedom-of-movement/freedom-of-movement-node.html].
hints.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_einer_aufent:
You've stated to possess a certificate of permission to reside (Aufenthaltsgestattung) and so you carry out the asylum procedure currently. Based on your information you are not allowed to apply for a residence permit with the help of this online-service.

This is a provisional assessment of the online service. For a definitive statement, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
hints.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_einer_duldun:
You've stated to possess a temporary suspension of deportation. Based on your information you are not allowed to apply for a residence permit with the help of this online-service.

...

This is a provisional assessment of the online service. For a definitive statement, please contact the responsible Immigration Office too.
hints.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_eines_eat_ne: You've stated to extend your residence permit. You can not continue without the copy of your previous residence permit.
hints.datenschutz_informationen_zum_datenschut:
Your Data is only processed for certain purpose
The Immigration Office responsible for processing your query about residence or freedom of movement collects your personal data (e.g., name, date of birth, nationality) as required to fulfill its legal duties. To this end, your personal details are stored in an immigrant file and in a central immigration register in accordance with immigration law. The information is used as the basis for issuing residence permits, certificates related to residence status, and notifications. In addition, your data is also processed as required for the purposes and execution of statutory provisions, other regulations and secondary provisions.

Your contact person: The Immigration Office
The following authority is responsible for processing your data:

{datenschutz_stelle}

The Immigration Office will provide further information about the processing of your data and your rights in connection with the processing of this data, and is the responsible instance in cases where you wish to assert these rights. This online service provides extensive information outlining how the Immigration Office processes personal data in the course of executing its legal duties here.

The data processing is regulated by law
The legal basis for these data processing activities is the Residence Act, the legal provisions passed under the Residence Act (including the residence directive, employment directive, integration course directive), the Asylum Act, the Act governing the general freedom of movement of EU citizens, the Central Immigration Register Act, the directive governing the execution of the Central Immigration Register Act, and the Brandenburg Data Protection Act.

Your data can only be shared under strict conditions
The data held by the Immigration Office may be shared with other Immigration Offices, other authorities, courts and, where applicable, authorities of other countries only where legally permissible.

Your data will be erased if no longer required
Your data will be stored for such time as the Immigration Office requires to complete its duties in observance of the statutory retention periods. Duties include correct record-keeping and observance of documentation obligations.
In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation, your data is deleted as soon as it is no longer required for the execution of duties. Data held in the individual immigration file under the Residence Act must be deleted ten years after you are no longer under the jurisdiction of the Immigration Office; if you are awarded citizenship or following death, the the data must be regularly deleted after five years. The data of an immigrant who has been expelled, sent back or deported will be deleted ten years after the bar restrictions have expired under Section 11 (2) of the Residence Act (AufenthG) in accordance with Section 91 (1) AufenthG.

You can assert your data privacy rights
You can request information from the Immigration Office about the processing of your stored personal data and about your rights in relation to the processing of this data. If the conditions stated in the General Data Protection Regulation are met, you can demand the correction, deletion or restriction of the processing of your personal data or object to the processing of your data. If you have consented to the processing of your data or a data processing contract exists and the data is processed using automated procedures, you may be able to assert a right to data portability. If you assert your rights, the Immigration Office will determine whether the legal prerequisites have been met.

If you believe that your personal data is being processed contrary to the law, you have a right to appeal to the (data protection) supervisory authority in accordance with Article 77 and Article 13 (2)(d) of the General Data Protection Regulation. {datenschutz_region}:

{datenschutz_agent}
{datenschutz_strasse}
{datenschutz_ort}
Tel.: {datenschutz_tel}
Fax: {datenschutz_fax}
E-mail: {datenschutz_email}

For more information, see the official website of the state commissioner, {datenschutz_link_text}.
hints.hinweise_ausfuellhinweise:
You can prepare for your visit to the Immigration Office here
This online service will help you to submit your application to the Immigration Office quickly and easily. Note that this is to prepare you for your personal visit to the Immigration Office. This online service does not replace a personal consultation in the Immigration Office. This is why every submission of an electronic application is followed by a personal visit to the Immigration Office, where you can again outline your situation in detail, provide further information or ask questions. The Immigration Office will then make a decision on your request.

The online service will provide you with information based on your input. This information does not constitute a decision of the Immigration Office. If you have any questions or are unable to proceed further, please contact the Immigration Office in person.

You can submit information subsequently
It does not matter if you do not yet have all the required information or documents when you submit your application. You can submit this to the Immigration Office later (e.g., by mail, email or fax).

Provide correct and complete information
If you choose to use this online service, please ensure the information you provide is correct and complete to the best of your knowledge. This will ensure the Immigration Office is able to process your application without significant delays. You also have the option to correct any information later. However, this should be done before your visit to the Immigration Office where possible.

Fields with an asterisk "*" are mandatory and must be completed.

Incorrect information may have a negative impact
Incorrect or incomplete information can delay the process and be disadvantageous to you. In the most serious cases, intentionally providing incorrect or incomplete information, which are not corrected towards the Immigration Office early enough, can result in the revocation of a right of residence, a fine, up to three years’ imprisonment or deportation from Germany.
hints.hinweise_einleitung: Read the following information carefully before starting the application.
hints.hinweise_gebuehrenpflicht:
Obligation to pay fees
A fee can be charged for processing your application, which may still be payable even if your application is withdrawn or rejected. The fee is charged by the Immigration Office. {gebuehrenpflicht}
hints.hinweise_geschaeftsfaehigkeit:
Legal capacity
Only legally competent persons can legally submit an application. This means you must be at least 18 years of age. If you are not yet 18 years of age, you must have a representative to use this online service.

Adult applicants of limited legal capacity or who are not legally competent must also be represented by a legally competent authorized person.
hints.hinweise_perspektive_sprache:
Perspective and form of address of the online service
The following pages are formulated from the perspective of the person who is applying for a residence document. This person can also nominate a representative. Information about the authorized representative can be provided in a later step.

For the sake of improved readability, there will be no simultaneous use of the female, male or diverse forms (m/f/d). All personal descriptions apply equally to all genders.
hints.infoversand_bestaetigung:
You have successfully submitted your application to the Immigration Office. A confirmation e-mail has been sent to the specified e-mail address.

Your case number is: {transactionKey}

The Immigration Office will determine whether it has all the information it requires to process your application. This may take several days on a case-by-case basis.

The Immigration Office will contact you if it requires more information or if your application has been processed. If your application is in order, you will be invited to arrange a personal interview in the Immigration Office.

In the meantime, we ask that you or third parties refrain from follow-up queries, and only contact the Immigration Office in very urgent cases.

If you need to submit further information to the Immigration Office (e.g., by mail, email or fax) always quote your case number.

hints.unterlagen_erst_einleitungstext:
You can submit copies of your documents to the Immigration Office here. This is voluntary. However, it will speed up the processing of your application if you provide the Immigration Office with as much information as possible in electronic form now. If you do not have all the documentation to hand, you can also submit this to the Immigration Office later.

If these are foreign documents, the Immigration Office also requires an official translation of these documents.

If you provide copies that contain more personal data than is needed for the Immigration Office to carry out its work, please redact the corresponding information. By clicking on the information field at the respective document, you can see which information from the document is required.

You can upload copies of your certificates in PDF, JPEG, or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
You have a total upload limit of {uploadMaxTotalSize} MB for your application.
hints.unterlagen_verl_datenvolumen: Total size of your upload files:
hints.unterlagen_verl_einleitungstext:
You can submit copies of your documents to the Immigration Office here. This is voluntary. However, it will speed up the processing of your application if you provide the Immigration Office with as much information as possible in electronic form now. If you do not have all the documentation to hand, you can also submit this to the Immigration Office later.

If these are foreign documents, the Immigration Office also requires an official translation of these documents.

If you provide copies that contain more personal data than is needed for the Immigration Office to carry out its work, please redact the corresponding information. By clicking on the information field at the respective document, you can see which information from the document is required.

You can upload copies of your certificates in PDF, JPEG, or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
You have a total upload limit of {uploadMaxTotalSize} MB for your application.

text.aufenthaltsstatus_upload_auslaendischer_:
For online applications, you only need to upload a copy of the front page that shows your photo (photo page). You can upload a copy of your foreign residence permit here in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.

The Immigration Office does not require the photo. This can be redacted from the copy.
text.aufenthaltsstatus_upload_bisheriger_aufe:
For online applications, you only need to upload a copy of the front page that shows your photo (photo page) in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.

The Immigration Office does not require the photo. This can be redacted from the copy.
text.aufenthaltsstatus_upload_einreisestempel:
For online applications, you need to upload a copy of the page of the passport with the entry stamp.

You can upload a copy here in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.aufenthaltsstatus_upload_visum:
For online applications, you need to upload a copy of the visa and of the page of the passport with the entry stamp.

You can upload a copy here in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_auslaendisch:
With a residence permit issued by a Schengen member state you possibly don't need an visa for the entrance to Germany. Nevertheless you have to apply for a residence permit for your stay in Germany.

Which states belong to the Schengen area you will learn here.
text.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_einer_aufent:
Persons who carry out the asylum procedure obtain a document named "permission to reside" (Aufenthaltsgestattung). This is only to certify the legal residence in Germany for the duration of the asylum procedure, but no residence permit.

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aufenthaltsgestattung (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)
text.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_einer_duldun:
Persons who are obliged to leave the country but whose deportation has been temporarily suspended obtain a document named "Duldung". This document normally is issued for short periods of time and does not impart a legal residence in Germany (that means the obligation to leave the country remains unchanged).

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aussetzung der Abschiebung (Duldung) (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)
text.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_eines_eat:
Residence title
The electronic residence title is issued by the Immigration Office as a cheque card-sized plastic card. The legal basis of the right of residence is written on front page (e.g., "Aufenthaltserlaubnis", EU Blue Card, ICT-card or Mobile ICT-card).


Image: Elektronischer Aufenthaltstitel (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)

Residence titles are now only issued on paper forms in exceptional cases for temporary use.

Permission to reside (Aufenthaltsgestattung) or temporary suspension of deportation (Duldung)
The certificate of permission to reside (Aufenthaltsgestattung) and the certificate of temporary suspension of deportation (Duldung) are no residence permissions. If you have one of these certificates you have to press "no".

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aufenthaltsgestattung (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aussetzung der Abschiebung (Duldung) (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)
text.aufenthaltsstatus_vorliegen_eines_visums: A visa is the confirmation issued by a German diplomatic mission that permits a visit to Germany or travel into or through Germany.
text.download_document_with_attachments: Here you can download your application with all the annexes and information required as zip archive. This process may take time. Please be patient.
text.handelndeperson_fuer_eine_3_person: Representatives may include parents acting on behalf of underage children, lawyers representing clients, or legally appointed carers (legal guardians).
text.handelndeperson_fuer_mich_selbst:
If your underage children join you to Germany you can add details of your children too. The Immigration Offce will assess their right of residence then.

Underage children are persons under the age of 18. If your child is already 18 years of age the residence permit should be applied independent from you (the application must be addressed to the Office separately).
text.hinweise_einschraenkung:
Permission to reside (Aufenthaltsgestattung)
Persons who carry out the asylum procedure obtain a document named "permission to reside" (Aufenthaltsgestattung). This is only to certify the legal residence in Germany for the duration of the asylum procedure, but no residence permit.

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aufenthaltsgestattung (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)

Temporary suspension of deportation (Duldung)
Persons who are obliged to leave the country but whose deportation has been temporarily suspended, obtains a document named "Duldung". This document normally is issued for short periods of time and does not impart a legal residence in Germany (that means the obligation to leave the country remains unchanged).

Image: Bescheinigung über die Aussetzung der Abschiebung (Duldung) (Source: Bundesministerium des Innern, für Bau und Heimat)
text.kinder_adresszusatz_kind:
You can enter an address suffix to indicate the addressee or the specific location of the address in more detail. Address suffixes may include
  • c/o (care of),
  • FAO (for the attention of).
text.kinder_aufenthalt_des_zweiten_sorgeberec: If an underage child follows one parent to Germany, the other parent which is also entitled to custody and who lives abroad has to agree to the residence of the child in Germany (statement of agreement).
text.kinder_geburtsort_oder_region_kind: Enter the place of birth here (city, district).
text.kinder_gueltigkeit_ausweisdokument_kind: Enter the issue date and expiry date of the current ID document. You can usually find this information on the front page of the document.
text.kinder_gueltigkeit_bis: You have entered an invalid date range. The start date must be before the end date.
text.kinder_nachweis_alleiniges_sorgerecht:
You can upload a copy of the court ruling or regulating agreement demonstrating custody or guardianship.

The Immigration Office requires complete documents in order to process your application. Therefore please ensure that your documents are legible and not redacted.

You can upload a copy in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.kinder_nachweis_ausweisdokument_kind:
You can upload an official identification document of your child here. This may be a passport, a German passport substitute document (e.g., travel document for foreigners, refugees or stateless persons or an emergency travel document) or a German substitute ID card.

For online applications, you only need to upload a copy of the page that shows the photo (photo page). The Immigration Office does not require the photo. This can be redacted from the copy.

You can upload a copy in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.kinder_nachweis_einverstaendniserklaerun:
If an underage child follows one parent to Germany, the other parent which is also entitled to custody and who lives abroad has to agree to the residence of the child in Germany.

You can upload the statement of agreement of the parent who lives abroad. The agreement should provice the following details:
  • the personal details of the underage child,
  • the personal details and contact details of both parents,
  • if necessary personal details of adult accompanying person.
The Immigration Office requires the complete document in order to process your query. Therefore please ensure that the document is legible and not redacted.

You can upload a file in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.kontaktdaten_adresszusatz:
You can enter an address suffix to indicate the addressee or the specific location of your address in more detail. Address suffixes may include
  • c/o (care of),
  • FAO (for the attention of).
text.kontaktdaten_e_mail_adresse: If you provide an e-mail address, you will receive an electronic confirmation of receipt after you have submitted the application.
text.kontaktdaten_ort: Enter the location of your main address here.
text.kontaktdaten_telefonnummer: If you provide a telephone number, the Immigration Office will be able to contact you by telephone. This information is voluntary.
text.nachweis_krankenversicherungsschutz:
Part of the evidence of your livelihood is a sufficient, financed out of its own resources and indefinite health insurance coverage. You can upload confirmation of existing health insurance cover from your health insurance scheme here.

The Immigration Office requires the complete document in order to process your query. Therefore please ensure that the document is legible and not redacted.
text.nachweis_sonstige_nachweise: If you wish, you can upload additional documents of your choice here.
text.nachweis_sprachkenntnisse:
In order for some residence permits to be issued, German language skills are required. The Immigration Office will determine whether you need to provide evidence of your language skills. If you already have a certificate, you can upload this here.

The Immigration Office requires complete documents in order to process your application. Therefore please ensure that your documents are legible and not redacted.
text.nachweis_verl_krankenversicherungsschutz:
Part of the evidence of your livelihood is a sufficient, financed out of its own resources and indefinite health insurance coverage. You can upload confirmation of existing health insurance cover from your health insurance scheme here.

The Immigration Office requires the complete document in order to process your query. Therefore please ensure that the document is legible and not redacted.
text.nachweis_verl_sonstige: If you wish, you can upload additional documents of your choice here.
text.nachweis_verl_zustimmung_personensorgebe:
You have stated that you have not yet reached the age of 18. A foreign minor has to obtain the consent of the minor's legal guardian to the intended stay in Germany.

The Immigration Office requires complete documents in order to process your application. Therefore please ensure that your documents are legible and not redacted.
text.nachweis_zustimmung_personensorgeberecht:
You have stated that you have not yet reached the age of 18. A foreign minor has to obtain the consent of the minor's legal guardian to the intended stay in Germany.

The Immigration Office requires complete documents in order to process your application. Therefore please ensure that your documents are legible and not redacted.
text.persoenlichedaten_familienstand:
Please choose one of the options.

In Germany, the family status indicates whether a person is single (unmarried/no partner), married, divorced, widowed or in a civil partnership.

Partnerships registered in Germany are legally recognized in Germany. Partnerships which were registered abroad can be legally recognized has to be investigated by the Immigration Office.
text.persoenlichedaten_geburtsdatum: You must be at least 18 years old to use the online service. If you are not yet 18 years of age, you must have a legally competent representative.
text.persoenlichedaten_geburtsort_oder_region: Enter your place of birth here (city, district).
text.persoenlichedaten_gueltigkeit_ausweisdok: Enter the issue date and expiry date of your current ID document. You can usually find this information on the front page of the document.
You have entered an invalid date range. The start date must be before the end date.
text.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_ausweisdokume:
You need an official document that includes your personal details, a passport photograph and your signature. This may be your passport, a German passport substitute document (e.g., travel document for foreigners, refugees or stateless persons or an emergency travel document) or a German substitute ID card.

For online applications, you only need to upload a copy of the page that shows your photo (photo page). You can upload a copy of your identification document here in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.

The Immigration Office does not require the photo. This can be redacted from the copy.
text.persoenlichedaten_staatsangehoerigkeit: Please indicate the country to which you belong. Owing to the non-standardized rules in individual countries, a person can have several nationalities or no nationality. You can enter up to three nationalities here.
text.plz_check_hint: The responsible body is the Immigration Office for the district in which the applicant is registered at his or her address, or, if the applicant has multiple addresses, his or her main address.
text.startseite_eroeffnungstext_erstbeantragu:
If you have already received a binding offer of employment from a German employer, please use the form "Erklärung zum Beschäftigungsverhältnis" (Declaration of Employment). This is a binding declaration by the employer that it has made you a concrete offer of employment and contains information that the Federal Employment Agency requires for its checks.
You can upload the declaration here.
text.startseite_erstbeantragung_aufenthaltsti: This field applies, if you either are not yet in possession of a residence permit or else are in possession of a different German residence permit (e.g., for gainful employment or family reunion).
text.startseite_verlaengerung_aufenthaltstite: This field applies if you want to extend your current residence permit for educational purposes. Please check the field above if you hold a residence permit for any other reason but for educational purposes.
text.vertretung_adresszusatz:
You can enter an address suffix to indicate the addressee or the specific location of your address in more detail. Address suffixes may include
  • c/o (care of),
  • FAO (for the attention of).
text.vertretung_e_mail_adresse: If you provide an e-mail address, you will receive an electronic confirmation of receipt after you have submitted the application.
text.vertretung_geburtsdatum: Only legally competent persons may use the online service to represent a third person.
text.vertretung_hausnummer: Please enter the house number. You may also enter one additional character or an auxiliary number, part number or a number range. Example: 124 A, 109.5, 1a 1/2, 1-3.
text.vertretung_ort: Enter the location of your main address or business here.
text.vertretung_postfachadresse: Your can enter a valid adress of a post office box if available. When entering a post office box there is no need to enter a street or house number.
text.vertretung_telefonnummer: If you provide a telephone number, the Immigration Office will be able to contact you by telephone. This information is voluntary.
text.vertretung_vertretungsnachweis:
If you are representing a third person in immigration matters, you must provide proof of proxy. Evidence may include a letter of proxy issued by the third person. The document should include the following information:
  • Details of the person on whose behalf you wish to act: Surname, first name, date of birth, address
  • Your details: Surname, first name, date of birth, address
  • Scope of proxy: The letter of proxy must specify which actions you are entitled to undertake (e.g., apply for a residence permit, collect a document). The letter of proxy can also be issued as a general power of attorney (e.g., "to act as representative in official matters").
  • Signature of the person on whose behalf you wish to act: The letter of proxy must be signed in the person’s own hand.
Public documents (e.g., birth certificate, court rulings) can also be used as evidence of authorized representation.
Please upload a copy of your evidence here in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.zusammenfassung_zusammenfassung_pruefung: All the information has been provided. You can now submit your application online.
text.persoenlichedaten_adresszusatz_kind:
You can enter an address suffix to indicate the addressee or the specific location of the address in more detail. Address suffixes may include
  • c/o (care of),
  • FAO (for the attention of).
text.persoenlichedaten_aufenthalt_des_zweiten: If you move to Germany with an underage child and one parent live abroad, which is
text.persoenlichedaten_geburtsort_oder_region: Enter the place of birth here (city, district).
text.persoenlichedaten_gueltigkeit_ausweisdok: Enter the issue date and expiry date of the current ID document. You can usually find this information on the front page of the document.
text.persoenlichedaten_gueltigkeit_bis_kind: You have entered an invalid date range. The start date must be before the end date.
text.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_alleiniges_so:
You can upload a copy of the court ruling or regulating agreement demonstrating custody or guardianship.

The Immigration Office requires complete documents in order to process your application. Therefore please ensure that your documents are legible and not redacted.

You can upload a copy in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_ausweisdokume:
You can upload an official identification document of your child here. This may be a passport, a German passport substitute document (e.g., travel document for foreigners, refugees or stateless persons or an emergency travel document) or a German substitute ID card.

For online applications, you only need to upload a copy of the page that shows the photo (photo page). The Immigration Office does not require the photo. This can be redacted from the copy.

You can upload a copy in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_einverstaendn:
If an underage child follows one parent to Germany, the other parent which is also entitled to custody and who lives abroad has to agree to the residence of the child in Germany.

You can upload the statement of agreement of the parent who lives abroad. The agreement should provice the following details:
  • the personal details of the underage child,
  • the personal details and contact details of both parents,
  • if necessary personal details of adult accompanying person.
The Immigration Office requires the complete document in order to process your query. Therefore please ensure that the document is legible and not redacted.

You can upload a file in PDF, JPEG or PNG format. The maximum file size is {uploadMaxFileSize} MB.
text.persoenlichedaten_ort_kind: Enter the location of the main address here.

datenueberpruefung.aufenthaltsstatus_upload_auslaendischer_: Copy of your foreign residence permit
datenueberpruefung.hinweise_bestaetigung_der_kenntnisnahme: I have read the above information.
datenueberpruefung.kinder_adressabfrage_kind: Will the child live with you in a shared household?
datenueberpruefung.kinder_anzahl_kinder: For how many children you want to send an application? You can transmit the data of up to five children.
datenueberpruefung.kinder_nachweis_ausweisdokument_kind: ID document (ID card, passport or passport replacement)
datenueberpruefung.kinder_nachweis_einverstaendniserklaerun: Statement of agreement from the expatriate parent
datenueberpruefung.nachweis_sprachkenntnisse: Evidence of your German language skills
datenueberpruefung.nachweis_verl_lebensumstaende: Evidence of change to personal circumstances
datenueberpruefung.nachweis_verl_zustimmung_personensorgebe: Consent of the minor's legal guardian
datenueberpruefung.nachweis_zustimmung_personensorgeberecht: Consent of the minor's legal guardian
datenueberpruefung.persoenlichedaten_aufenthalt_des_zweiten: Does the parent which is also entitled to child custody live abroad?
datenueberpruefung.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_ausweisdokume: Copy of your identity document (passport, replacement passport or replacement ID)
datenueberpruefung.persoenlichedaten_sorgerecht: Do you have sole child custody of the child?
datenueberpruefung.vertretung_bestaetigung_der_vertretungsb: I confirm that I am authorized by the third person to submit the application in his or her name. I understand that all of the following formulations are formulated in the first person from the point of view of the applicant.
datenueberpruefung.vertretung_vertretungsart: Please indicate how you will represent the foreign national:
datenueberpruefung.persoenlichedaten_adressabfrage_kind: Will the child live with you in a shared household?
datenueberpruefung.persoenlichedaten_nachweis_einverstaendn: Statement of agreement from the expatriate parent

familienstand.LE: Termination of the partnership through declaration of death

validation.is: The e-mail addresses do not match.
validation.bestaetigung_hinweise: This is a mandatory field. Confirmation is required to continue with your application. Confirm, if your read the information.
validation.zusammenfassung_bestaetigung_richtig: This is a mandatory field. Confirmation is required to continue with your application. If anything is unclear, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
validation.zusammenfassung_bestaetigung_nachreichen: This is a mandatory field. Confirmation is required to continue with your application. If anything is unclear, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
validation.zusammenfassung_bestaetigung_konsequenze: This is a mandatory field. Confirmation is required to continue with your application. If anything is unclear, please contact the responsible Immigration Office.
